choices.C: Provides network monitoring services for Layer 3 devices.
choices.A: Provides public cloud services for customers that need Internet access.
choices.B: Controls the turn-up of a device.

questions.question_text: What is the role of NSO?

comments.content: exactly what I thought before checking the comments.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

choices.B: flowspec address-family ipv4 install interface-all local

discussion.content:
A is Correct
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_bgp/configuration/xe-16-6/irg-xe-16-6-book/C3PL-BGP-Flowspec-Client.html

Device(config-flowspec)# address-family ipv4 
Device(config-flowspec-af)# local-install interface-all

questions.question_text: Which configuration enables BGP FlowSpec client function and installation of policies on all local interfaces?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I've tested it in my lab and it indeed works:

(config)#router bgp 3351
(config-router)#bgp upgrade-cli
You are about to upgrade to the hierarchical AFI syntax of bgp commands
Are you sure? [yes]: yes

So, it's option B.

Selected Answer: B
R1(config)#router bgp 61000
R1(config-router)#bgp upgrade-cli 
You are about to upgrade to the hierarchical AFI syntax of bgp commands
Are you sure ? [yes]:

Selected Answer: B
To upgrade a Network Layer Reachability Information (NLRI) formatted router configuration file to the address-family identifier (AFI) format and set the router command-line interface (CLI) to use only AFI commands, use the bgp upgrade-cli command in router configuration mode.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/iproute_bgp/command/reference/irg_book/irg_bgp1.html#:~:text=or%20peer%20group.-,bgp%20upgrade%2Dcli,-To%20upgrade%20a

questions.question_text: An engineer is moving all of an organization's Cisco IOS XE BGP routers to the address-family identifier format. Which command should be used to perform this upgrade quickly with the minimum service disruption?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Vague and unclear question but answer must be C:

Key Cisco NFVI roles include:

Control (including Networking)
Compute
Storage
Management (including logging, and MONITORING)<<<<<<<

https://content.cisco.com/chapter.sjs?uri=/searchable/chapter/content/en/us/td/docs/net_mgmt/network_function_virtualization_Infrastructure/2_2_x/Cisco_VIM_Install_Guide_2_2_x/Cisco_VIM_Install_Guide_2_2_x_chapter_00.html.xml

questions.question_text: What is the role of NFVI?

choices.B: ip cef ip flow-export version 9 bgp-nexthop ip flow-export destination 192.168.1.1 9996 interface gigabitethernet 1/0/1 ip flow ingress
choices.C: ip cef ip flow-export version 5 ip flow-export destination 192.168.1.1 9995 interface gigabitethernet 1/0/1 ip flow ingress cdp enable
choices.A: ip cef ip flow-export version 5 bgp-nexthop ip flow-export destination 192.168.1.1 9995 interface gigabitethernet 1/0/1 ip flow egress
choices.D: no ip cef ip flow-export version 9 ip flow-export destination 192.168.1.1 9996 interface gigabitethernet 1/0/1 ip flow ingress ip flow egress

questions.question_text: A network engineer is implementing NetFlow to observe traffic patterns on the network. The engineer is planning to review the patterns to help plan future strategies for monitoring and preventing congestion as the network grows. If the captures must include BGP next-hop flows, which configuration must the engineer apply to the router?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
R1(config)#ip flow-export version 9 bgp-nexthop 
*Jul 18 00:42:58.933: %PARSER-5-HIDDEN: Warning!!! ' ip flow-export version 9 bgp-nexthop ' is a hidden command. Use of this command is not recommended/supported and will be removed in future.

comments.content: Configure NetFlow v9 (Version 9) data export (if only Version 5 is configured, then BGP next hop data is visible in the caches, but is not exported)
